text: 2000 Market Street is a high-rise office building located in the Market West region of Philadelphia. The building stands at a height of 435 feet (133 meters) with 29 floors, and was completed in 1973. It is currently tied with Two Logan Square as the 17th-tallest building in Philadelphia. The architect of the building was Pitcairn Properties, Inc. ==Tenants== * Santander Bank * Fox Rothschild LLP * The Board of Pensions of the Presbyterian Church (USA) * The Coventry Deli * John Dolan Enterprises, LLC * Marshall Dennehey Warner Coleman & Goggin, P.C. ==See also== * List of tallest buildings in Philadelphia * Buildings and architecture of Philadelphia ==References== ==External links== * Emporis * SkyscraperPage Category:Skyscraper office buildings in Philadelphia Category:Office buildings completed in 1973
title: 2000 Market Street
